title: How to Create and Sell Digital Products Online
description: Creating and selling digital products is one of the most popular ways to make money online. In this article, I will share what digital products are, how to create them, and how to turn them into a profitable business.  What Are Digital Products? Digital products are documents or files that can be downloaded or accessed... The post How to Create and Sell Digital Products Online appeared first on Well Kept Wallet.
author: Deacon Hayes
excerpt: Selling digital products online provides an opportunity for a profitable income stream. Here's a look at how to get started.
text: Creating and selling digital products is one of the most popular ways to make money online. In this article, I will share what digital products are, how to create them, and how to turn them into a profitable business.  What Are Digital Products? Why You Should Sell Digital Products? How To Sell Digital Products Online Step 2: Consider What Kind of Product to Create Step 3: Building the product Step 5: Pick a Selling Platform Step 6: Market Your Product Step 7: Offer Great Customer Service Step 8: Collect Feedback and Optimize What Are Digital Products? Digital products are documents or files that can be downloaded or accessed online. This type of product is generally more appealing because there is no need to store physical products that must be shipped and handled. Instead, they can delivered in real-time to the customers. Here are examples of digital products: eBooks Courses Music Software Templates Stock photos  Since digital products have virtually no overhead, are easily distributable, and can be sold to any consumer across the globe, they are a popular choice among creators.  Why You Should Sell Digital Products? Having a side hustle to make extra cash is possible using digital products. Here are some good reasons to sell digital products: Low Startup Cost: You don’t need a warehouse, stock, or a storefront. The majority of the work consists of building the product and promoting it. Passive Income: After you create a digital product, you’ll sell it repeatedly with little extra work.   Scalability: You can sell digital products to as many customers as possible without worrying about selling out. Global Reach: Digital products can be sold to anyone, anywhere, as long as you have internet access. Now, let’s put this together, and I’ll show you how to get started. Step 1: Pick a Niche The first step in creating digital products is choosing a niche. A niche is a topic or area that your product will focus on. Selecting the perfect niche is important as it defines your audience and separates you from other online competition.  Here are a few tips for choosing a niche: Pursue Your Passion and Expertise: Select a niche that best reflects what you are passionate about or knowledgeable about. It will simplify the process of developing high-quality products. Market Demand: Investigate whether product demand exists within your selected niche. Tools such as Google Trends or keyword research tools can be used to check users’ interests. Competition: In some cases, competition can be good as it indicates a desire for that product or service, but do not choose niches that have too many people already doing it, unless you bring something that they don’t. Step 2: Consider What Kind of Product to Create Now that you have a niche, the next step is to decide on what type of digital product you want to create.  Some of the best-selling products include: eBooks: This digital book can be sold as a PDF or on other platforms like Amazon Kindle. eBooks are a terrific way to impart knowledge or write a story. Online Courses: Teach a skill or subject and build video lessons, quizzes, and downloadable resources. Platforms like Teachable or Udemy can serve as a launchpad. Templates: Create templates for resumes, social media posts, or websites. Businesses and individuals are in high demand for this. Stock Photos and Graphics: If you’re a photographer or a graphic artist, you can sell your work on websites like Shutterstock or Etsy. Software / Apps: Develop tools or applications that address specific needs. Music and Audio Files: Original music, sound effects, or audiobooks. Step 3: Building the product This is the time to create your digital product. Here’s how to do it: Decide on your content: What are the different parts of your product? For instance, if you are drafting an eBook, prepare a table of contents first. Use The Right Tools: Invest in quality tools and software. Use Canva for design templates, Capcut for video editing, or Microsoft Word for writing, for example. Quality Matters: Have a high-quality product that will provide value to your customers. For example, customers will probably not recommend this product if your merchandise has a bad design or not useful content. Test Your Product: Ensure you’re launching a tested product that works properly. For instance, review each video and the links when developing an online course. Step 4: Set a Price Determining a price for your digital product can be tricky. You don’t want to pitch the price too high and chase away customers, but you also don’t want to undercut your work. Here are a few tips: Research Competitors: Check the going price for similar products in your niche. Look at Value: Determine how your product offers value. If it addresses a major pain point or provides valuable information, you can increase the price. Offer Multiple Tiers: Consider offering a basic version of your product at a lower price point and a premium version with additional features at a higher price point. Step 5: Pick a Selling Platform There are plenty of platforms for selling digital products. Here are some of the most common apps to sell your stuff online: Your Website: Build your own website using platforms such as WordPress or Wix. This puts you in charge of branding and customer experience. Use an e-commerce platform: Sites like Shopify and Gumroad are good options for selling your products. Marketplaces: List your products on marketplaces, such as Amazon, Etsy, or Creative Market. These platforms have existing audiences but will likely charge a commission on your sales. Social Media: Use platforms like Instagram or Facebook to sell your products directly. Step 6: Market Your Product Just because you built a great product doesn’t mean anyone will buy it. Now you have to market it. There are a few tactics you can use: Use an email list: Leverage email marketing to update potential customers on your upcoming product. Sites like AWeber focus on email marketing.  Leverage Social Media: Post attractive and interesting content about your product on the most vibrant social media platforms — Instagram, Twitter, or LinkedIn. Start a Blog: Write articles on topics related to your niche and link to your product. It can also help boost your website’s search engine ranking. Partner with Influencers: Work with social media influencers in your space to help promote your product. Run Ads: Pay-for-performance advertising, such as Google or Facebook ads, can help you target a wider audience. Step 7: Offer Great Customer Service Excellent customer service can either build or ruin your online business. Ask questions, understand complaints, and act quickly. Respond quickly to customers and offer refunds if necessary. Happy customers are likelier to post positive reviews or spread the word about your product. Step 8: Collect Feedback and Optimize Get customer feedback after launching your product. Leverage feedback to iterate on your existing product or build new features. Stay competitive in the digital market through incremental improvements. Summary Building and selling digital products provides an opportunity for a profitable second income stream. These steps will help transform your skills and passions into a great side hustle to make money.  Success does not come overnight, so be prepared for the journey. It requires time, energy, and persistence. However, if you formulate a good plan and prioritize quality, you can create a successful e-commerce business connecting with consumers globally. Deacon Hayes paid off $52,000 of debt in only 18 months and now is helping others do the same. Over ten years ago, Deacon created Well Kept Wallet to be a resource that can transform the average persons financial life. Deacon has been featured in many news publications including Yahoo Finance, US News & World Report, CNN Money, and more. He is also the author of You Can Retire Early!: Everything You Need to Achieve Financial Independence When You Want It.
html:
Creating and selling digital products is one of the most popular ways to make money online. In this article, I will share what digital products are, how to create them, and how to turn them into a profitable business. 

  1. What Are Digital Products?

  2. Why You Should Sell Digital Products?

  3. How To Sell Digital Products Online

    2. Step 2: Consider What Kind of Product to Create

    3. Step 3: Building the product

    5. Step 5: Pick a Selling Platform

    6. Step 6: Market Your Product

    7. Step 7: Offer Great Customer Service

    8. Step 8: Collect Feedback and Optimize

What Are Digital Products?

Digital products are documents or files that can be downloaded or accessed online. This type of product is generally more appealing because there is no need to store physical products that must be shipped and handled. Instead, they can delivered in real-time to the customers.

Here are examples of digital products:

  • eBooks
  • Courses
  • Music
  • Software
  • Templates
  • Stock photos 

Since digital products have virtually no overhead, are easily distributable, and can be sold to any consumer across the globe, they are a popular choice among creators. 

Why You Should Sell Digital Products?

Having a side hustle to make extra cash is possible using digital products.

Here are some good reasons to sell digital products:

  • Low Startup Cost: You don’t need a warehouse, stock, or a storefront. The majority of the work consists of building the product and promoting it.
  • Passive Income: After you create a digital product, you’ll sell it repeatedly with little extra work.  
  • Scalability: You can sell digital products to as many customers as possible without worrying about selling out.
  • Global Reach: Digital products can be sold to anyone, anywhere, as long as you have internet access.

Now, let’s put this together, and I’ll show you how to get started.

Step 1: Pick a Niche

The first step in creating digital products is choosing a niche. A niche is a topic or area that your product will focus on. Selecting the perfect niche is important as it defines your audience and separates you from other online competition. 

Here are a few tips for choosing a niche:

  • Pursue Your Passion and Expertise: Select a niche that best reflects what you are passionate about or knowledgeable about. It will simplify the process of developing high-quality products.
  • Market Demand: Investigate whether product demand exists within your selected niche. Tools such as Google Trends or keyword research tools can be used to check users’ interests.
  • Competition: In some cases, competition can be good as it indicates a desire for that product or service, but do not choose niches that have too many people already doing it, unless you bring something that they don’t.

Step 2: Consider What Kind of Product to Create

Now that you have a niche, the next step is to decide on what type of digital product you want to create. 

Some of the best-selling products include:

  • eBooks: This digital book can be sold as a PDF or on other platforms like Amazon Kindle. eBooks are a terrific way to impart knowledge or write a story.
  • Online Courses: Teach a skill or subject and build video lessons, quizzes, and downloadable resources. Platforms like Teachable or Udemy can serve as a launchpad.
  • Templates: Create templates for resumes, social media posts, or websites. Businesses and individuals are in high demand for this.
  • Stock Photos and Graphics: If you’re a photographer or a graphic artist, you can sell your work on websites like Shutterstock or Etsy.
  • Software / Apps: Develop tools or applications that address specific needs.
  • Music and Audio Files: Original music, sound effects, or audiobooks.

Step 3: Building the product

This is the time to create your digital product. Here’s how to do it:

  • Decide on your content: What are the different parts of your product? For instance, if you are drafting an eBook, prepare a table of contents first.
  • Use The Right Tools: Invest in quality tools and software. Use Canva for design templates, Capcut for video editing, or Microsoft Word for writing, for example.
  • Quality Matters: Have a high-quality product that will provide value to your customers. For example, customers will probably not recommend this product if your merchandise has a bad design or not useful content.
  • Test Your Product: Ensure you’re launching a tested product that works properly. For instance, review each video and the links when developing an online course.

Step 4: Set a Price

Determining a price for your digital product can be tricky. You don’t want to pitch the price too high and chase away customers, but you also don’t want to undercut your work. Here are a few tips:

  • Research Competitors: Check the going price for similar products in your niche.
  • Look at Value: Determine how your product offers value. If it addresses a major pain point or provides valuable information, you can increase the price.
  • Offer Multiple Tiers: Consider offering a basic version of your product at a lower price point and a premium version with additional features at a higher price point.

Step 5: Pick a Selling Platform

There are plenty of platforms for selling digital products. Here are some of the most common apps to sell your stuff online:

  • Your Website: Build your own website using platforms such as WordPress or Wix. This puts you in charge of branding and customer experience.
  • Use an e-commerce platform: Sites like Shopify and Gumroad are good options for selling your products.
  • Marketplaces: List your products on marketplaces, such as Amazon, Etsy, or Creative Market. These platforms have existing audiences but will likely charge a commission on your sales.
  • Social Media: Use platforms like Instagram or Facebook to sell your products directly.

Step 6: Market Your Product

Just because you built a great product doesn’t mean anyone will buy it. Now you have to market it. There are a few tactics you can use:

  • Use an email list: Leverage email marketing to update potential customers on your upcoming product. Sites like AWeber focus on email marketing. 
  • Leverage Social Media: Post attractive and interesting content about your product on the most vibrant social media platforms — Instagram, Twitter, or LinkedIn.
  • Start a Blog: Write articles on topics related to your niche and link to your product. It can also help boost your website’s search engine ranking.
  • Partner with Influencers: Work with social media influencers in your space to help promote your product.
  • Run Ads: Pay-for-performance advertising, such as Google or Facebook ads, can help you target a wider audience.

Step 7: Offer Great Customer Service

Excellent customer service can either build or ruin your online business. Ask questions, understand complaints, and act quickly.

Respond quickly to customers and offer refunds if necessary. Happy customers are likelier to post positive reviews or spread the word about your product.

Step 8: Collect Feedback and Optimize

Get customer feedback after launching your product. Leverage feedback to iterate on your existing product or build new features. Stay competitive in the digital market through incremental improvements.

Summary

Building and selling digital products provides an opportunity for a profitable second income stream. These steps will help transform your skills and passions into a great side hustle to make money. 

Success does not come overnight, so be prepared for the journey. It requires time, energy, and persistence. However, if you formulate a good plan and prioritize quality, you can create a successful e-commerce business connecting with consumers globally.

Deacon Hayes paid off $52,000 of debt in only 18 months and now is helping others do the same. Over ten years ago, Deacon created Well Kept Wallet to be a resource that can transform the average persons financial life.

Deacon has been featured in many news publications including Yahoo Finance, US News & World Report, CNN Money, and more.

He is also the author of You Can Retire Early!: Everything You Need to Achieve Financial Independence When You Want It.
